title: China will 'keep champagne on ice' over US trade deal as factory woe deepens
text:
Beijing said it would "keep the champagne on ice" after reaching a tentative truce in its tariff war with the US, as fresh data showed trade between the two countries has collapsed by more than a fifth this year.

Chinese exports slipped 3.2pc year-on-year in September in the biggest fall for seven months while total imports tumbled 8.5pc, the joint sharpest slide in more than three years as domestic demand stalls. Trade between the world’s two largest economies plunged by 21pc compared to September 2018 as new tariffs came into effect.

The latest setback suggests the global factory downturn was accelerating before a partial deal struck by the US and China last week cooled tensions.
